result.execSummary:
The defendant Raynard R Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Sentence Credit for 77 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $169.20 to be paid to Walmart  as a Condition of Probation.
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Submit to a mental health assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

No contact with Walmart.  No new law violations.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Letter dated 3/25/17 from defendant, requesting to have time serving for fines run concurrent to revocation time.  **Reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 4/3/17 - see form letter**

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC.  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Raynard R Robinson in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
- 6 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED.  Credit for 77 days if revoked.
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $253.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Restitution of $169.20 to be paid to Walmart as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  No new law violations.  Maintain full-time employment.  No contact with Walmart.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Submit to a mental health assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.   Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UA's.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Request for adjournment filed by plaintiff.
Filed by the State with attached Witness List.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.
No contact with any Wal Mart store.

Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as not all discovery was provided. Court sets the matter on the trial calendar. Court modified the bail.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
